alert.note: Alert for Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 9:46PM CDT until July 15 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Little River near Tecumseh affecting Pottawatomie and Seminole Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Little River near Tecumseh. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Near bankfull flows occur along the river and downstream of Lake Thunderbird... from near Macomb in Pottawatomie County to near Bowlegs in western Seminole County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Friday the stage was 5.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The Little River is expected to rise to a crest of 10.0 feet tomorrow morning. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1000 AM CDT.
